comment: Excellent overall.  It’s worth the effort to buy some if you can find it.

What a bourbon should be! Very nice vanilla and caramel notes accompanied with the drier oak and tobacco flavors. The finish is a nice lengthy vanilla, oak and leather harmony. A pure pleasure to sip.

Nose- Sweet grass and grain. Reminds me of Irish whiskey.
Body- really easy on the tongue with vanilla and honeysuckle following by grass and raw peanuts.
Finish- the grass continues into a hint of lemon zest. 

Very good!
Very classic, well made bourbon, especially for a craft distillery, very expensive though. Not worth $100
While it’s a solid bourbon it isn’t spectacular in any way. Wouldn’t buy another bottle
Far too sweet for me.  Think slow and low rye.
